quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Languages and World
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, creole, vernacular. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Sentence structure can be described in the following way: S=Subject. O=Object. V=Verb. There are 6 possible sentence structures: SVO (as English is), SOV (as German is), OSV, OVS, VSO, and VOS. Of these 6 possible sentence structures, which one has never been found to exist?

options.text: None of these. All 6 have been found.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these. All 6 have been found.

questions.question: The word shylock, which refers to a ruthless moneylender, is derived from the name of a character appearing in what Shakespearean play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Merchant of Venice

questions.question: Which of these musical instruments was named after a person?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: saxophone

questions.question: What is Ebonics (also known as African American Vernacular and Black English)?

options.text: Neither a language nor a dialect
A separate language in its own right
An artificial construct to satisfy some politicians ambitions

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A dialect of English

questions.question: The term Quizling, which means a traitor, is derived from the name of Vidkun Quisling, who assisted Nazi Germany while serving as Minister-President of this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Norway

questions.question: What Ancient Greek lyric poet was born on the island of Lesbos from which the term lesbian is derived?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sappho

questions.question: The word gargantuan is an eponym derived from a character, depicted by this 16th century French author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: François Rabelais

questions.question: Which of the following languages is a highly inflected language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russian

questions.question: Of all the languages in the world today, how many are written languages?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 200

questions.question: The name of the famous womanizer Giacomo Casanova has become synonymous with the art of seduction. Who wrote the book Histoire de ma vie which covers part of Casanovas life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giacomo Casanova

questions.question: Which one of the following languages is not in the same language family as the others?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Finnish

questions.question: Approximately how many spoken languages are there in the world today?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6000

questions.question: What does the linguistics term creole mean?

options.text: A language which is adopted from a pidgin language, but is more complex, with its own grammatical rules.
A person who speaks a pidgin
A person descended from slaves who lives in Louisiana

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A language which is adopted from a pidgin language, but is more complex, with its own grammatical rules.

questions.question: The phrase Herculean task, meaning a difficult task that requires great effort, originates from the stories of the Twelve Labors of the divine hero Hercules. Which of these is not one of the labors Hercules had to perform?

options.text: Clean the Augean stables in a single day

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Take fire from Mount Olympus

questions.question: Which statement about English is true?

options.text: It is a language related to German in structure, but with a great deal of French vocabulary.
It is descended primarily from the ancient Viking language.
It is In the same language family as Hungarian.
It is in the same language family as Chinese.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is a language related to German in structure, but with a great deal of French vocabulary.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Yoga and Prana
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Blue jean baby, LA lady, seamstress for the band is the beginning line in this Elton John song. Who is the Ballerina, you must have seen dancing in the sand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tiny Dancer

questions.question: Yoga originates from this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: India

questions.question: Yogic postures are know as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asanas

questions.question: Which of these is a principle of Yoga
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of the above

questions.question: That which enters the body is called Prana and that which leaves it is called Apana.  What does Prana mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Life force

questions.question: Each Yoga path is suited to a different temperament or approach to life.  How many different main paths are there in Yoga?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: Bhakti Yoga is the path of this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Devotion or Divine Love

questions.question: Considered by many to be one of the greatest American dancers, this Kirov Ballet dancer defected while touring in Canada in 1974. He became the Principle Dancer for the American Ballet Theatre. Which dancer played Carrie Bradshaws Russian boyfriend in Sex in the City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mikhail Baryshnikov

questions.question: What is the origin of the word maverick, which refers for a person of independent views?

options.text: It is derived from the name of a guitar, called Fender Maverick.
It is derived from the name of The Mavericks, a country music band.
It is derived from the name of Samuel Maverick, a Texan who lived in the 19th century.
It is derived from the western TV series Maverick.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is derived from the name of Samuel Maverick, a Texan who lived in the 19th century.

questions.question: The breathing exercises, pranayama help with this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of the above

questions.question: The modern sandwich is possibly named after the 4th Earl of Sandwich, who allegedly ordered his servant to bring him meat tucked between two pieces of bread, as he was unwilling to leave this activity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: gambling

questions.question: This American woman is often called the Mother of Modern Dance. She was a hit in Europe but many Americans disapproved of her life style and politics. Whose last words were reported to be Goodbye my friends, I am off to glory.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isadora Duncan

questions.question: Which of these weapons, named after people, is colloquially known as The Gun That Won the West?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winchester rifle

questions.question: Yoga literally means this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Union

questions.question: Although in western culture she is known for the Dance of the Seven Veils, the Bible only says she danced for Herod. Her dancing pleased Herod so much that he promised her anything she wanted. What famous dancer asked for the head of John the Baptist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salome

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Word and Gods
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, mean, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: She was the prima ballerina for the New York City Ballet from 1947 to 1960. She was married to George Balanchine, one of the greatest ballet choreographers of the 20th century, who wrote some of his most famous works for her. What famous ballerina danced Balanchines The Firebird and originated the role of the Sugar Plum Fairy in Balanchines The Nutcracker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marie Tallchief

questions.question: What is the meaning of the proverb Aquila non captat muscas?

options.text: Mouses are hard to catch even for a strong man.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The eagle doesnt capture flies.

questions.question: What is the name of the dancer described in the following lyrics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. Bojangles

questions.question: What is the translation of the saying Cui peccare licet peccat minus?

options.text: If you dont watch out you wont go far.
One who is allowed to sin, sins less.
When one tries to harm others, he harms himself.
The less one knows, the better off they are.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One who is allowed to sin, sins less.

questions.question: What does the word lupus mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wolf

questions.question: What is the translation of the Latin saying Finis vitae sed non amoris?

options.text: The end of life is not the end of love.
There is no life without love.
There is life even after there is no more love.
There is no love at the end of life.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The end of life is not the end of love.

questions.question: What does the Latin word bellum mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: War

questions.question: What does the Latin word spiro mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Breathe

questions.question: In Norse mythology, what kind of animals are Odins two companions that kept him informed of various events?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ravens

questions.question: The main difference between Norse gods and gods of other cultures is that Norse gods are not immortal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is Bifrost in North mythology?

options.text: the rainbow bridge that leads to Asgard
the serpent that kills Thor at Ragnarok
Odins great hall for fallen warriors
the wolf that kills Odin at Ragnarok

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the rainbow bridge that leads to Asgard

questions.question: What is the name of the dwelling place of the Norse gods?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asgard

questions.question: What does the Latin word felicitas mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Happiness

questions.question: She came out strutting wearing only a button and a bow. But it was the grand finale that got the audience every time. She did a triple somersault and when she hit the ground, she winked at the audience and then she turned around. Who had a tattoo of a cowboy pictured on her spine that said Phoenix,  Arizona 1949?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Egypt

questions.question: The word Friday is derived from Frigg, the Norse goddess who was wife of Odin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Artemis and Legends
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mean, artemis. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the meaning of goddess Artemis title Elaphebolus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deer shooting

questions.question: What did the archaic term prithee mean?

options.text: An interjection used to express a polite request

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An interjection used to express a polite request

questions.question: The Temple of Artemis is one of Worlds Seven Wonders. Where is it located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ephesus

questions.question: What does the Latin phrase Dum spiro spero mean?

options.text: This is the spirit of hope.
Hope comes when you take a breath.
I hope my soul will live on.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: While I breathe, I hope.

questions.question: According to legends why did Artemis transform the hunter Actaeon into a stag?

options.text: Because he refused to build her a temple.
Because he spied her when she bathed and saw her naked.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because he spied her when she bathed and saw her naked.

questions.question: What does the term wench refer to?

options.text: A medieval tool used for drilling holes in wood
A wrench used in medieval times
A slab or piece of wood used in constructing a house

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A young peasant girl

questions.question: What does the word sylvan mean as an adjective?

options.text: That which has a silver color
Of or pertaining to the woods

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Of or pertaining to the woods

questions.question: What did the archaic term strumpet refer to?

options.text: A breed of dog now extinct

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A prostitute

questions.question: Which one of these names was given to Artemis by her worshipers in Athens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Agrotera

questions.question: Was Aeginaea the name given to Artemis by her worshippers in Sparta?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: The palm tree was sacred for Artemis because it is connected with her and her twin brother Apollos birth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What does the Latin word nemo mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nobody

questions.question: Which of these words is an adverb meaning away?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: avaunt

questions.question: What does the Latin word copia mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abundance

questions.question: According to the legends, how many dogs did Artemis take with her while hunting?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Meaning and Saying
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, mean, example. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What did the term phlogiston originally refer to?

options.text: A herb used to alleviate fevers by the ancient Greeks
An instrument of torture and interrogation used by the ancient Greeks
A type of wheel used on Roman chariots

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What is the meaning of the archaic word betwixt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Between

questions.question: Finish the popular proverb: Necessity is the mother of ....
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Invention

questions.question: What did the name Albion refer to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Britain

questions.question: What is the meaning of the popular proverb, Stolen fruit is the sweetest?

options.text: The best things in life are free.
Anything is good as long as its free.
One craves things that are forbidden.
One appreciates things they havent paid for.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One craves things that are forbidden.

questions.question: How does the popular saying end: Pride comes before ...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A fall

questions.question: What is the missing word in the popular saying: All is fair in love and ...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: War

questions.question: What is the meaning of the popular saying, One good turn deserves another?

options.text: If youve started something good its very hard to stop.
If youve been lucky, try your luck once again.
If you enjoy something, dont stop doing it.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Always return a favor.

questions.question: What is the missing first word in the popular saying ... is the father of wisdom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Experience

questions.question: What did the archaic adjective anile mean?

options.text: Originating or from the Nile river
Of or like a senile old woman

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Of or like a senile old woman

questions.question: What is the missing word in the popular proverb Dogs of the same street ... alike?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bark

questions.question: Finish the popular proverb: A good example is the best ....
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sermon

questions.question: What is the missing part from the popular saying, ... are not made by sitting in the shade?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gardens

questions.question: The archaic term puissant meant weak or wimpy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the missing part from the popular saying, ... often gives a small thing a big shadow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Worry

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Wind and Proverb
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, proverbs, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What popular proverb is hidden behind these words: The stylus is more potent than the claymore?

options.text: The pen is mightier than the sword.
Men make houses, women make homes.
Knowledge in youth is wisdom in age.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The pen is mightier than the sword.

questions.question: What proverb could this refer to: Elementary sartorial techniques initially applied obviate the need for repetitive similar actions to the square of three?

options.text: A stitch in time saves nine
Marry in haste, repent at leisure

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A stitch in time saves nine

questions.question: Which of these popular proverbs means the opposite of Silence is golden?

options.text: The squeaky wheel gets the grease
Saying is one thing, doing is another

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The squeaky wheel gets the grease

questions.question: What is the missing word in the popular proverb, If you chase two ____  you will not catch either one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rabbits

questions.question: How does the popular proverb end: When the cats away, the mice ___ ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Play

questions.question: Which were the two authors of the 1955 Broadway play Inherit the Wind?

options.text: Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee
Jerome Robbins and Robert E. Lee

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee

questions.question: What popular saying could this be: There is illumination at the termination of the subterranean excavation?

options.text: It is always darkest before the dawn
Theres a light at the end of the tunnel
He who plays with fire gets burnt

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theres a light at the end of the tunnel

questions.question: Who wrote the screenplay for the 1960 Hollywood film Inherit the Wind?

options.text: Nathan E. Douglas and Harold Jacob Smith
Harold Baines and John R. Diefenbach

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nathan E. Douglas and Harold Jacob Smith

questions.question: Who played Henry Drummond in the 1960 movie Inherit the Wind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spencer Tracy

questions.question: What saying is the opposite of Good things come in small packages?

options.text: An empty purse frightens away friends
Half a loaf is better than none
All that glitters is not gold

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The bigger the better

questions.question: Where does the title of the play Inherit the Wind come from?

options.text: The Bible, the Book of Psalms
The Bible, the Book of Proverbs
The Bible, the Book of Job

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bible, the Book of Proverbs

questions.question: What is the missing from the popular saying, One mans trash is another mans ...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Treasure

questions.question: The story in the 1955 Broadway play Inherit the Wind is a fictionalized version of what famous event in US history?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The 1925 Scopes trial

questions.question: What popular proverb does this refer to: A disposition towards inquiry deprived the feline of its vital state?

options.text: All cats are grey in the dark

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Curiosity killed the cat

questions.question: Which of these proverbs the reverse of  Wise men think alike?

options.text: An idle brain is the devils workshop
Birds of a feather flock together
There is a black sheep in every flock

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fools seldom differ
